newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL -- Iomega seen weakening.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL -- Iomega seen weakening.

text.p: Iomega Corp shares are expected to weaken at the start of trade Tuesday after the company said it will take a $10 million fourth quarter charge related to staff cuts at its Utah plant and relocation of its European headquarters.
The producer of removable computer disk drives also said thecharge is part of an increase in production at its Penang, Malaysia, plant.
Last night after the news was released, Iomega shares fell 1/2 to 16, breaking through a year-low 16-1/4.
Also, Zitel Corp added one to 42 after the stock fell 20-1/4 points Monday.
The sharp decline was attributed to the disapation of a market rumor that influential investor George Soros was interest in buying in the computer software and services company.
Meanwhile, Biogen gained 1-5/8 to 39 after Bear Stearns reiterated a buy rating on the stock.
Dell Computer added 1/4 to 52-1/2 after NatWest raised its earnings estimates on the stock.
Among other active pre-open shares, Microsoft rose 5/8 to 84-1/8, 3Com added 1/16 to 75-3/16, Novell Inc traded in line with the prior close at 9-1/2, and Qualcomm shed one to 39-1/2.
